case of S.J. Grange Ltd v. Customs and Excise Commissioners (1979) STC 183,
a VAT case,  wherein a single notice of assessment was issued for a period of 21
months  from  15.04.1973  to  31.12.1974  showing  a  single  amount  of  tax  due  and
payable  by  the  company  for  the  said  21  months  periods  on  the  basis  that  the
trader’s returns were incomplete and incorrect.  The prescribed accounting period
for VAT liability under Section 31 (2) of the UK Finance Act, 1972 was a period of
3  months.  The  company  challenged  the  notice  stating  that,  for  an  assessment
made  under  Section  31  (1)  to  be  valid,  it  has  to  be  restricted  to  a  prescribed
accounting  period  of  three  months  and  it  ought  to  have  been  split  up  to  three
monthly periods and accordingly, the assessment in question was invalid since it
related to a continuous period of 21 months.
